Posts.Content: Jul 15, 2012 12:56AM mimi24 wrote: Woke up about 9 weeks ago with severe stiff neck and shooting pains into skull.  Rhemy tried prednisone pack and then cortisone injections without success. Referred me to Ortho who tried a 2nd prednisone tx which was unsuccessful.  The Ortho said he was mystified and said the prednisone should have worked.  He sent me for mri of cervical spine and I'm waiting on results.  I am a basket case thinking this may be skull mets.  I'm still in pain, the neck is stiff and have intermittent shooting pains.  Has anyone had these symptoms?  Thanks.
Posts.Title: If you are not Stage IV but have questions, you may post here chrissyb Olma61

Posts.Content: Jul 15, 2012 01:18AM mimi24 wrote: P.S. Is there any way to get the threads to appear in order of most current first? Thx.
Posts.Title: If you are not Stage IV but have questions, you may post here chrissyb Olma61

Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2012 02:42AM mimi24 wrote: Thank you to everyone who replied.  After 3 mri's, a pet scan and a bone scan, the doc finally decided it was severe inflammation from my arthritic neck that caused the fluid on the spine that showed up on the mri......which precipitated the pet scan which showed "stuff", which precipitated the bone scan. Whew, what a mouthful..........anyway.........that sound you hear as you read this is a big whopping sigh of relief.  Now I just have to convince my heart doc I need to be on some kind of anti-inflammatory so this doesn't happen again.  (He had told me to stop taking it in April.)  My best wishes are with everyone who has the need to post on this board.  Pat
